snippet: Justices asked parties in a Nigerian suit to help answer the question of jurisdiction in a case involving the Alien Tort Statute.
abstract: Supreme Court calls for additional briefs to be filed and a re-argument to be held in a human rights case filed by Nigerian plaintiffs against the Royal Dutch Petroleum Company over whether corporations can be sued for complicity in torture abroad; action is taken after several justices question whether American courts might ever hear disputes under the law for human rights abuses in a foreign country, whether the defense was a corporation or not.
lead_paragraph: Justices asked parties in a Nigerian suit to help answer the question of jurisdiction in a case involving the Alien Tort Statute.
